title: Exhibition Power and Powerlessness, St. John's Church
img_alt: Sculpture Dialogue by Seiji Kimoto, St. John's, Saarbrücken
intro_text: During Lent from March 10 to March 28 in 2012, 22 sculptures by Kimoto from the cycle "Power and Powerlessness" have been on display in St. John's Church, Saarbrücken. Shown publicly for the first time was sculpture "Dialogue", made specially for this exhibition by Seiji Kimoto. Saarland Minister for Home Affairs, Culture and Europe, Stephan Toscani, acted as patron of the exhibition. The laudatory speech was given by former Prime Minister of Saarland, Reinhard Klimmt. Seiji Kimoto was also performing in a Rakusho event along with double bass player Rudolf Schaaf in the ancillary program on March 16.
